document_data.name: '''''Hands of Paymon'''''
document_data.creator: [[Tenambulum]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Hands of Paymon''''' was a set of gloves that contained a bound [[demon]]. The [[rogue]] [[Gage]] took them from the [[wizard]] and [[demon]]-binder [[Tenambulum]] on {{yearlink|1374}},{{cite book/Stardeep|20-21|3}}Tenambulum is not explicitly stated to have created the gloves, but given his background as a demon-binder and the fact that the gloves contain a bound demon, later released, seem to strongly point to that Tenambulum created them. Likewise, the alignment of the demon is not openly stated, but as all demons are supposed to embody Chaotic Evil, this article proceeds under that assumption. and wore them until {{yearlink|1375}}.{{cite book/Stardeep|243-245|22}}
document_data.Description: Though nondescript, those gauntlets were warm to the touch, almost hot. The right glove bore a mouth with a too-sinuous tongue, dripping with venom and leading to a bottomless darkness on its palm, while the left glove had an eye on the back of the hand.
document_data.Powers:
The right glove allowed its wielder to teleport across walls.{{cite book/Stardeep|27-29|3}} The mouth could also find purchase in immaterial souls, allowing it to devour phantasmal undead.{{cite book/Stardeep|48|5}} It was also capable of tracking,{{cite book/Stardeep|241-242|22}} sniffing out corpses{{cite book/Stardeep|143|12}} and of emmitting a dangerous, keening wail capable of disabling even a knight in full armor.{{cite book/Stardeep|146|12}}

The left glove was an aid while searching for secret doors.{{cite book/Stardeep|27|3}}
document_data.History: Gage had acquired the glove while sacking the tower of the [[wizard]] [[Tenambulum]], looking for a tome, [[Glyphs and Griffons]], on {{yearlink|1374}}, a year before [[1375 DR]].{{cite book/Stardeep|46-47|5}} and his right glove was later destroyed in an alchemical explosion, releasing the [[demon]] bound within.
